paper.title: 2023年6月英语六级听力真题（第二套）

questions.question_text: Why is the woman interested in architecture?

options.text: She is attracted to the beauty of modern buildings.
She is preoccupied with her dream to be an architect.
She is influenced by her father who teaches architecture.
She is drawn to its integration of design and engineering.

questions.question_text: How did the woman manage to get into the architecture program?

options.text: Through hard work.
With the professor's help.
By studying the subject online.
By taking prerequisite courses.

questions.question_text: What does the woman think about architecture?

options.text: It is groundbreaking.
It is long-lasting.
It is immaterial.
It is immortal.

questions.question_text: What subject does the woman think would be helpful for architects?

options.text: Economics.
Philosophy.
Computer science.
Western art.

questions.question_text: What do we learn about Mr. Sanchez from the conversation?

options.text: He has occasionally been harassed by his fans.
He has been guarded by a discreet assistant.
He is well known to the public.
He is a famous football coach.

questions.question_text: What will the man probably do for Mr. Sanchez?

options.text: Serve as a personal assistant.
Play a key role in Real Madrid.
Run common daily chores for the woman.
Help promote Mr. Sanchez's public profile.

questions.question_text: What does the woman say about the man?

options.text: He is honest and always tells the truth.
He once worked part-time in university.
He cares little about his working hours.
He has little previous work experience.

questions.question_text: What is the man's strength according to the woman?

options.text: He has a strong ability to connect with people.
He has a high proficiency in several languages.
He has a sound knowledge of sports consultancy.
He has a natural capacity to cooperate with others.

questions.question_text: What does the passage say about traditional team sports?

options.text: They bring more benefits to young people.
They require less supervision and training.
They are more suitable to young people.
They have fewer rules and pressures.

questions.question_text: What is the negative effect of too many safety rules according to the passage?

options.text: They prevent kids from enjoying adventure sports.
They help kids guard against any possible injuries.
They rob kids of the chance to cultivate their courage.
They deprive kids of the opportunity to develop team spirit.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker suggest parents do for their children?

options.text: Help them take up these sports when they are more mature.
Let them participate in some less risky outdoor activities.
Ask them to try some forms of indoor sports.
Introduce them to these sports step by step.

questions.question_text: What is the main reason for the short lifespan of tech products?

options.text: Consumers often have a craving for the latest model.
Such products tend to comprise parts that are irreplaceable.
Tech firms intentionally design products to have short lifespans.
Manufacturers use effective strategies to promote fancier products.

questions.question_text: What are tech firms required to do in France?

options.text: Indicate the competitiveness of their products.
List a repairability score of their products.
Specify the major parts of their products.
Detail the life cycle of their products.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker suggest tech companies do?

options.text: Take the initiative to reduce electronic waste.
Take due caution in upgrading their products.
Invest in constructing more recycling facilities.
Substitute all toxic substances with non-toxic ones.

questions.question_text: What is the speaker's attitude toward the problem of electronic waste?

options.text: It can be solved.
It is certain to worsen.
It will be fixed by tech companies.
It is unavoidable in the long run.

questions.question_text: What is the lecture mainly about?

options.text: How internet monitoring can be implemented.
How to encourage productive internet surfing.
How cyberloafing affects overall productivity.
How to prevent employees from cyberloafing.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about cyberloafing?

options.text: Cyberloafing is a sign of workers' laziness.
Cyberloafing may relieve employees of stress.
Employee engagement is closely related to job satisfaction.
Overuse of social media may lead to decline in productivity.

questions.question_text: What conclusion can be drawn from the lecture?

options.text: Taking mini-breaks means better job performance.
Cyberloafing generally does more harm than good.
Worker turnover is linked to the time allowed for cyberloafing.
Employees who indulge in internet surfing are most likely to quit.

questions.question_text: What was Nebraska like in the mid-19th century?

options.text: There were no wooden buildings.
There were environmental problems.
There were no trees.
There were few settlers.

questions.question_text: What did Julius Sterling Morton do to promote tree planting?

options.text: He served as chairman of the Nebraska State Board of Agriculture.
He urged the state to start the Nebraska State Gardening Society.
He engaged himself in a large number of aesthetic projects.
He founded a newspaper and used it to promote his ideas.

questions.question_text: What happened on the first Arbor Day in 1872?

options.text: A special prize was awarded to Julius Morton.
One million trees were planted throughout Nebraska.
The state government declared it the official Arbor Day.
Nebraska earned the nickname "the Tree Planters State".

questions.question_text: What does the lecture say about modern humans?

options.text: They spread across Europe and Asia in a few decades.
They lived mostly in Africa for about 200,000 years.
They preferred to live in Europe rather than in Asia.
They moved out of Africa about 60,000 years ago.

questions.question_text: What evidence challenges the traditional view of human migration?

options.text: The discovery of two modern human teeth in China.
The traces of human migration out of Africa to Asia.
The human fossils discovered most recently in Africa.
The Luna cave in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region.

questions.question_text: Why was the Arabian Peninsula an ideal place for early humans?

options.text: There must have been some reason for human migration.
There have been changes in animals' living conditions.
Humans adapted themselves to the environment there.
Humans had access to abundant food sources there.

questions.question_text: What is the lecture mainly about?

options.text: How humans settled down on the Arabian Peninsula.
When modern humans started to disperse out of Africa.
What path modern humans took to migrate out of Africa.
Why fresh water is so important for human survival.
